Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: NEW KINGDOM (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Name: Bowl
Description: Bowl placed in a burial. This type of vessel was widespread and most probably mass produced. The clay is fine, common and buff-coloured. The shape is tall and hemispherical, with a tapered lip in continuation of the body of the vessel. The exterior surface has been polished, although the lump created at the beginning of the throwing process is still visible at the bottom of the vessel.  There is a red stripe on the rim.
